body_html:
I see. I think it would be good for the error message to tell you that - could save someone else a confusing few minutes.
…
On Oct 3, 2017, 2:37 AM -0400, Adam Paszke ***@***.***>, wrote: It's always been like this, and I don't think we can do anything about it easily (maybe apart from adding a note that this has already happened in the error message). The problem is that a Function declares that it modified something when it's running, so we only see it afterwards. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. On Oct 3, 2017, 2:37 AM -0400, Adam Paszke ***@***.***>, wrote:
 It's always been like this, and I don't think we can do anything about it easily (maybe apart from adding a note that this has already happened in the error message). The problem is that a Function declares that it modified something when it's running, so we only see it afterwards.

body:
I see. I think it would be good for the error message to tell you that - could save someone else a confusing few minutes.

On Oct 3, 2017, 2:37 AM -0400, Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com>, wrote:
> It's always been like this, and I don't think we can do anything about it easily (maybe apart from adding a note that this has already happened in the error message). The problem is that a Function declares that it modified something when it's running, so we only see it afterwards.
> —
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.
